SEARCH
Package it.polimi.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<PlayerChoice>
public class GameController extends Object implements Observer<PlayerChoice>
GameController is the class that acts as controller in the MVC pattern
Author:
Nicola Siniscalchi, Lorenzo Pittelli
See Also:

    • handleMessage

      protected void handleMessage(PlayerChoice message)
      Checks on player's choices notified to GameController, based on those it calls specific Game methods to allow game prosecution and proceed to next turn
      Parameters:
      message - player's choice

    • convertOrder

      public int[] convertOrder(String s) throws NumberFormatException, OrderException
      Converts order of insert received from the player into an int array that can be used from handleMessage method
      Parameters:
      s - string containing order of insertion
      Returns:
      an array of int containing order of insertion
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain correctly formatted numbers
      OrderException - if the order is wrong

    • convertColumn

      public int convertColumn(String s) throws NumberFormatException
      Converts column where to insert received from the player into an int that can be used from handleMessage method
      Parameters:
      s - string containing the number of column chosen
      Returns:
      chosenColumn integer reference
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string does not contain correctly formatted number

    • convert

      public ObjectCard[] convert(String s) throws EmptyTileException, NumberFormatException, CoordinateException
      Converts the coordinates of chosen objects received from the player into an ObjectCard array that can be used from handleMessage
      Parameters:
      s - string containing x/y coordinates of chosen objects
      Returns:
      Throws:
      EmptyTileException
      NumberFormatException
      CoordinateException

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Calls Game method to setup the game, like the board, the common goal(s), the personal goal(s) and chooses the first player to start

    • checkOrder

      protected boolean checkOrder(int[] chosenInsertionOrder) throws DifferentLengthException, OrderException
      Checks if the order chosen by the player is correct and satisfy the rules of the game
      Parameters:
      chosenInsertionOrder - player's chosen order of insertion
      Returns:
      true if is correct, false else
      Throws:
      DifferentLengthException
      OrderException

    • checkPickedObject

      protected boolean checkPickedObject(ObjectCard[] pickedObject) throws MaxDrawableObjectsException, NoFreeSidesException, AlreadyPickedException, NoStraightLineException, NoAdjacentException
      Checks if player's chosen object can be taken, are correct and satisfy game's rules
      Parameters:
      pickedObject - player's chosen object
      Returns:
      true if can be picked, false else
      Throws:
      MaxDrawableObjectsException - if can't be taken because of not available free spots in player's bookshelf
      NoFreeSidesException - if can't be taken because does not have at least 1 free side
      AlreadyPickedException - if can't be picked because was already picked
      NoStraightLineException - if can't be picked because are not placed on a straight line on the board
      NoAdjacentException - if can't be picked because are not adjacent

    • savePickedObject

      protected void savePickedObject(ObjectCard[] pickedObject)
      Removes chosen objects from the board and saves them into current player's chosenObject attribute
      Parameters:
      pickedObject - player's chosen objects

    • checkChosenColumn

      protected boolean checkChosenColumn(int column) throws OutOfBookshelfException
      Check if chosen column can be used and is correct based on game's rules
      Parameters:
      column - chosen column
      Returns:
      true if can be used, false else
      Throws:
      OutOfBookshelfException - if the chosen column is out of bookshelf bounds
